verses.verse: So I <S%H589><s%> returned, <S%H7725><s%> and considered <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the oppressions <S%H6217><s%> that <S%H834><s%> are done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun: <S%H8121><s%> and behold <S%H2009><s%> the tears <S%H1832><s%> of such as were oppressed, <S%H6217><s%> and they had no <S%H369><s%> comforter; <S%H5162><s%> and on the side <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%> of their oppressors <S%H6231><s%> there was power; <S%H3581><s%> but they had no <S%H369><s%> comforter. <S%H5162><s%>

Wherefore I <S%H589><s%> praised <S%H7623><s%> <S%H853><s%> the dead <S%H4191><s%> which are already <S%H7945><s%> <S%H3528><s%> dead <S%H4191><s%> more than <S%H4480><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%> which <S%H834><s%> <S%H1992><s%> are yet <S%H5728><s%> alive. <S%H2416><s%>

Yea, better <S%H2896><s%> is he than both <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8147><s%> they, <S%H853><s%> which <S%H834><s%> hath not <S%H3808><s%> yet <S%H5728><s%> been, <S%H1961><s%> who <S%H834><s%> hath not <S%H3808><s%> seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> that <S%H834><s%> is done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Again, I <S%H589><s%> considered <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> travail, <S%H5999><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> right <S%H3788><s%> work, <S%H4639><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> for this <S%H1931><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> is envied <S%H7068><s%> of his neighbor. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7453><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
The fool <S%H3684><s%> foldeth his hands together, <S%H2263><s%> <S%H853><s%> <S%H3027><s%> and eateth <S%H398><s%> <S%H853><s%> his own flesh. <S%H1320><s%>

Better <S%H2896><s%> is a handful <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4393><s%> <S%H3709><s%> with quietness, <S%H5183><s%> than both the hands <S%H2651><s%> full <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4393><s%> with travail <S%H5999><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
Then I <S%H589><s%> returned, <S%H7725><s%> and I saw <S%H7200><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

There is <S%H3426><s%> one <S%H259><s%> alone, and there is not <S%H369><s%> a second; <S%H8145><s%> yea, <S%H1571><s%> he hath neither <S%H369><s%> child <S%H1121><s%> nor brother: <S%H251><s%> yet is there no <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7093><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> his labor; <S%H5999><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> is his eye <S%H5869><s%> satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with riches; <S%H6239><s%> neither saith he, For whom <S%H4310><s%> do I <S%H589><s%> labor, <S%H6001><s%> and bereave <S%H2637><s%> <S%H853><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> of good? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2896><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity, <S%H1892><s%> yea, it <S%H1931><s%> is a sore <S%H7451><s%> travail. <S%H6045><s%>
Two <S%H8147><s%> are better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> one; <S%H259><s%> because <S%H834><s%> they have <S%H3426><s%> a good <S%H2896><s%> reward <S%H7939><s%> for their labor. <S%H5999><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> if <S%H518><s%> they fall, <S%H5307><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> will lift up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H853><s%> his fellow: <S%H2270><s%> but woe <S%H337><s%> to him that is alone <S%H259><s%> when he falleth; <S%H7945><s%> <S%H5307><s%> for he hath not <S%H369><s%> another <S%H8145><s%> to help him up. <S%H6965><s%>
Again, <S%H1571><s%> if <S%H518><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> lie together, <S%H7901><s%> then they have heat: <S%H2552><s%> but how <S%H349><s%> can one <S%H259><s%> be warm <S%H3179><s%> alone?

And if <S%H518><s%> one <S%H259><s%> prevail against <S%H8630><s%> him, two <S%H8147><s%> shall withstand <S%H5975><s%> <S%H5048><s%> him; and a threefold <S%H8027><s%> cord <S%H2339><s%> is not <S%H3808><s%> quickly <S%H4120><s%> broken. <S%H5423><s%>

Better <S%H2896><s%> is a poor <S%H4542><s%> and a wise <S%H2450><s%> child <S%H3206><s%> than an old <S%H2205><s%> and foolish <S%H3684><s%> king, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4428><s%> who <S%H834><s%> will <S%H3045><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> be admonished. <S%H2094><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> out of prison <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1004><s%> <S%H631><s%> he cometh <S%H3318><s%> to reign; <S%H4427><s%> whereas <S%H3588><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> he that is born <S%H3205><s%> in his kingdom <S%H4438><s%> becometh poor. <S%H7326><s%>

I considered <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%> which walk <S%H1980><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> child <S%H3206><s%> that <S%H834><s%> shall stand up <S%H5975><s%> in his stead. <S%H8478><s%>

There is no <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7093><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the people, <S%H5971><s%> even of all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> have been <S%H1961><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them: they also <S%H1571><s%> that come after <S%H314><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in him. Surely <S%H3588><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7475><s%> of spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
